abstract.text: An object that lays out plain text for printing, possibly over multiple pages.

inlineContent.text: class allows you to specify global font, color, and text alignment properties for the printed text. To use this print formatter for a print job, create an instance of
initialized with the text, set the text properties and the inherited layout properties, and add the object to the print job in one of two ways:
If a single print formatter is being used for the print job (with no additional drawing), assign it to the
property identifies the beginning page of content with which the formatter is associated.

If you are using multiple formatters along with a page renderer, associate each print formatter with a starting page of the printed content. You often take this approach when you want to add content such as headers and footers to what the formatters provide. You have two ways of associating a print formatter with a
You can add print formatters to the
property of the print formatter specifies the starting page.
You can add print formatters by calling
for each print formatter; the second parameter of this method specifies the starting page (and overrides any
You can change the text at any time before drawing of the printable content begins. You cannot change the text after drawing begins.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that lays out HTML text for a multipage print job.
An abstract base class for print formatters, which are objects that lay out custom printable content that can cross page boundaries.
The index of the first page that the print formatter lays out.
A user interface that manages the printing of documents, images, and other printable content in iOS.
An object that lays out the content of pages according to the kind of content.
An object that draws pages of content to print, with or without the assistance of print formatters.
Adds a print formatter to the page renderer starting at the specified page.
The print formatters for the page renderer.
An object that lays out plain text for printing, possibly over multiple pages.
A string of attributed text.
The color of the printed text.
The font of the printed text.
Returns a simple-text print formatter initialized with attributed text.
Returns a simple-text print formatter initialized with plain text.
A string of plain text.
The alignment of the printed text.
An object that lays out the drawn content of a view for printing.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
